alert.note: Alert for Clark (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 3:18AM CST until December 15 at 9:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Impacts Today Through Thursday... A wintry mix continues in north-central Wisconsin this morning with multiple rounds of precipitation persisting into Thursday. Icing, especially on elevated surfaces such as bridges, may result in slippery to hazardous driving conditions as well as tree damage from winds gusting near 45 mph. This wintry mix will alleviate midday before another round of snow develops tonight. Several inches of snow are possible Wednesday night in north- central Wisconsin. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches and ice accumulations around a tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Clark County. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
